name: Taj Mahal
description: The iconic white marble mausoleum, symbol of eternal love, built by Emperor Shah Jahan for his wife Mumtaz Mahal.

name: Jaipur Pink City
description: Known for its historic forts, vibrant markets, and the City Palace, Jaipur is a beautiful blend of tradition and modernity.

name: Varanasi Ghats
description: A spiritual and cultural hub, Varanasi is famous for its ghats along the Ganges River, hosting religious ceremonies and rituals.

name: Kerala Backwaters
description: A network of lagoons, lakes, and canals, offering a serene and picturesque experience of the Kerala countryside.

name: Golden Temple
description: The spiritual and cultural center for Sikhs, the Golden Temple is a stunning architectural marvel surrounded by a sacred pool.

name: Hampi Ruins
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Hampi is known for its ancient ruins, temples, and historical significance.

name: Rishikesh and Haridwar
description: Nestled in the Himalayas, these twin towns are famous for their spiritual significance, yoga, and the Ganga Aarti.

name: Goa Beaches
description: Renowned for its vibrant nightlife and pristine beaches, Goa is a popular tourist destination with a unique blend of cultures.

name: Khajuraho Temples
description: A group of stunning temples with intricate erotic sculptures, showcasing medieval Indian architecture and artistry.

name: Mysore Palace
description: A grand palace known for its Indo-Saracenic architecture, Mysore Palace is a cultural and historical landmark.

name: Qutub Minar
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Qutub Minar is the tallest brick minaret in the world, reflecting Indo-Islamic architecture.

name: Ajanta and Ellora Caves
description: These ancient rock-cut caves showcase exquisite sculptures and paintings, depicting Buddhist and Hindu art.

name: Rann of Kutch
description: The largest salt desert in the world, Rann of Kutch transforms into a surreal white landscape during the Rann Utsav.

name: Andaman and Nicobar Islands
description: Known for pristine beaches and diverse marine life, these islands offer a tranquil escape in the Bay of Bengal.

name: Sundarbans National Park
description: The largest mangrove forest in the world, home to the Bengal tiger and diverse flora and fauna.

name: Rajasthan Desert Safari
description: Embark on a thrilling desert safari in the golden sands of Rajasthan, experiencing the rich culture of the desert.

name: Elephant Cave
description: A rock-cut cave temple on Elephanta Island, featuring impressive sculptures dedicated to Lord Shiva.

name: Chittorgarh Fort
description: One of the largest forts in India, Chittorgarh Fort narrates tales of valor and sacrifice from Rajput history.

name: Ladakh
description: A high-altitude desert region surrounded by majestic mountains, Ladakh is known for its unique landscapes and monasteries.

name: Munnar
description: A hill station surrounded by tea plantations, Munnar offers breathtaking views of lush green landscapes.

name: Jodhpur - The Blue City
description: Famous for its blue-painted houses and Mehrangarh Fort, Jodhpur is a captivating city in the Thar Desert.

name: Pangong Lake
description: A stunning high-altitude lake surrounded by snow-capped mountains, famous for its changing colors.

name: Konark Sun Temple
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, the Sun Temple is known for its intricate architecture dedicated to the Sun God.

name: Shimla
description: A popular hill station, Shimla is known for its colonial architecture, scenic landscapes, and pleasant weather.

name: Khimsar Fort
description: An enchanting fort surrounded by sand dunes, offering a royal experience in the Thar Desert.

name: Bodh Gaya
description: A sacred pilgrimage site for Buddhists, Bodh Gaya is where Siddhartha Gautama attained enlightenment.

name: Nainital
description: A charming hill station with a pear-shaped lake, surrounded by lush greenery and snow-capped mountains.

name: Chennai Marina Beach
description: One of the longest urban beaches in the world, Marina Beach is a popular spot for locals and tourists alike.

name: Rajgir
description: An ancient city with historical and religious significance, Rajgir is surrounded by hills and lush greenery.

name: Kaziranga National Park
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Kaziranga is known for its conservation of the Indian one-horned rhinoceros.

name: Aurangabad Caves
description: Rock-cut caves with intricate carvings, representing the art and architecture of ancient India.

name: Kanyakumari
description: The southernmost tip of the Indian mainland, offering breathtaking views of the confluence of three seas.

name: Ranikhet
description: A serene hill station with panoramic views of the Himalayas, known for its pine-covered hills.

name: Dudhsagar Waterfalls
description: One of the tallest waterfalls in India, Dudhsagar is surrounded by lush greenery and is a popular trekking destination.

name: Chandigarh Rose Garden
description: A beautiful garden with thousands of rose varieties, showcasing vibrant colors and fragrances.

name: Bikaner - The Camel City
description: Known for its camel safaris and the Junagarh Fort, Bikaner is a fascinating city in the Thar Desert.

name: Pondicherry
description: A charming coastal town with French colonial influence, Pondicherry is known for its tranquility and unique blend of cultures.

name: Mahabodhi Temple
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Mahabodhi Temple marks the spot where Buddha is said to have attained enlightenment.

name: Matheran
description: A quaint hill station with a no-vehicle policy, Matheran offers a peaceful retreat amidst nature.

name: Agumbe
description: Known as the 'Cherrapunji of the South,' Agumbe is a scenic destination with lush green landscapes and waterfalls.

name: Bhimbetka Rock Shelters
description: A UNESCO World Heritage Site, Bhimbetka is known for its ancient rock paintings, depicting prehistoric life.

name: Panchgani
description: A picturesque hill station with scenic views of the Sahyadri mountains, known for its strawberry farms.
